intro: Allophylus kilimandscharicus, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa, particularly the mountainous areas of Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in montane forests. Allophylus kilimandscharicus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
